com.googlecode.cqengine.index.sqlite.support

Class SQLiteIndexFlags

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.cqengine.index.sqlite.support.SQLiteIndexFlags

  • public class SQLiteIndexFlags
extends Object
    Flags which can be set in query options (via QueryFactory) which allow the behaviour of SQLiteIndex to be adjusted.
    Author:
    niall.gallagher

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SQLiteIndexFlags.BulkImportExternallyManged
      A 2-values flag that enables externally managed bulk import and specifies it's status.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String BULK_IMPORT
      A flag which if enabled causes the SQLiteIndex to temporarily drop the index on a table prior to adding objects, then to restore the index after objects have been added.
      static String BULK_IMPORT_SUSPEND_SYNC_AND_JOURNALING
      Switches off the 'synchronous' and 'journal_mode' pragmas before executing a bulk import.

    • Field Detail

      • BULK_IMPORT

        public static String BULK_IMPORT
        A flag which if enabled causes the SQLiteIndex to temporarily drop the index on a table prior to adding objects, then to restore the index after objects have been added.

        This should not be used if other concurrent operations might also be ongoing on the collection. It is intended for use when the collection is first being populated or similar, such as at application startup.

      • BULK_IMPORT_SUSPEND_SYNC_AND_JOURNALING

        public static String BULK_IMPORT_SUSPEND_SYNC_AND_JOURNALING

        Switches off the 'synchronous' and 'journal_mode' pragmas before executing a bulk import. Executing a bulk import with 'synchronous' and 'journal_mode' OFF can significantly increase the performances of the operation at a cost of a slightly higher risk of database corruption in case of system crashes or the power loses.

        The default values will be re-instated after the import.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SQLiteIndexFlags

        public SQLiteIndexFlags()
